alert.note: Alert for Sullivan (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN SULLIVAN AND CENTRAL PIKE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Greeley, or 14 miles west of Montague, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lackawaxen, Blooming Grove, Shohola, Eldred, Glen Spey, Greeley, Pecks Pond, Highland Lake, Millrift, and Twin Lakes. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 84 between 30 and 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central New York...and northeastern Pennsylvania.
